column1: Is it reasonable to describe the Vietnam War as an example of American overreach?
Was Nikita Khrushchev’s placement of missiles in Cuba in 1962 defensible as a deterrent to a possible future U.S. invasion of Cuba?
Was the U.S. invasion of Iraq premature given the faulty intelligence about WMDs?
Was the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons not strictly necessary to help bring about the end of World War II?
Was the U.S. invasion of Grenada in 1983 an overreach that may have conflicted with international law?
Is it fair to view the 1989 invasion of Panama as an act of American aggression?
Was the USAAF’s 1945 bombing of Dresden ethically questionable given its limited military-industrial capacity?
